title: Repository lacks version control initialization
recommendation: Initialize git with `git init` and add a .gitignore to enable change tracking and collaboration

title: Maintainer workflow and ownership guidance is not documented

evidence.snippet: No section describes module ownership, review expectations, or release/maintenance workflow.

recommendation: Add a concise maintainer-facing section (or CONTRIBUTING.md) documenting ownership, review checklist, and routine maintenance steps to reduce tribal knowledge.

title: Missing Dependency Management File

evidence.snippet: The project contains Python code within the 'runtime' and 'tests' directories but lacks a standard dependency management file (e.g., 'requirements.txt', 'pyproject.toml') in the root directory. This makes it difficult to install the correct dependencies and ensure a reproducible environment.

recommendation: Create a `requirements.txt` file by running `pip freeze > requirements.txt` in your activated virtual environment, or define dependencies in a `pyproject.toml` file to formalize project dependency management.

title: Project-local contribution guide is missing in repository root

evidence.snippet: No repository-local CONTRIBUTING.md is present in the provided scope.

recommendation: Add a root-level CONTRIBUTING.md that defines coding conventions, review expectations, and test/validation workflow to reduce onboarding and maintenance friction.

title: Multiple documentation files at project root

evidence.snippet: README.md, notes.md, task_plan.md, and 8 other .md files at root level

recommendation: Consider consolidating related documentation under docs/ directory for better organization
